alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 3:50AM EST until February 21 at 1:20AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT EARLY TUESDAY MORNING.. * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Williamsburg. * WHEN...Until just after midnight early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding threatens low lying roads and structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM EST Monday was 25.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is receding and is expected to fall below flood stage by late this evening and continue falling to around 17.0 feet by 7 AM EST on Tuesday. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The next statement will be issued by 4 PM EST today.
